#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
:mod:`mtcdb.dataset.activity` [module]

Class representing data structures for the neuronal activity.

Classes
-------
:class:`mtcdb.datasets.activity.RawSpikes`
    Raw data for one unit in one recording session.
:class:`mtcdb.datasets.activity.FiringRates`
    Firing rates for one unit in all the trials of all its recording sessions.
"""

import numpy as np
from numpy.typing import NDArray
from typing import Callable, Tuple
import xarray as xr

from mtcdb.constants import TBIN, SMPL_RATE, SMOOTH_WINDOW
from mtcdb.datasets.utils import DataHandler



[docs]class RawSpikes(DataHandler):
    """
    Raw data for one unit in one recording session.

    For each unit (neuron), raw data consists in its *spiking times*
    during all the trials of one recording session.
    
    Each spiking time (in seconds) is *relative* to the beginning of the trial
    in which is occured (i.e. time origin is resetted at 0 in each trial).
    
    Attributes
    ----------
    unit_id: str
        Unit's identifier.
    session_id: str
        Session's identifier.
    spikes: NDArray[np.float64]
        Spiking times for the unit in the session (in seconds).
        Times restart from 0 in each trial.
    trials: NDArray[np.int64]
        Trial indexes corresponding to spiking times (i.e. each time is associated
        with the the index of the trial in which it occurred).
        Stored in ascending order, from 1 to the number of trials in the session, 
        with contiguous duplicates (e.g. ``1111122223333...``).
    n_trials: int
        Number of trials in the session.
    sampling_rate: float
        Sampling time for the recording, in seconds.
    path_data: str 
        Directory where the data files of the unit are stored.
    
    Methods
    -------
    get_path()
        Construct the path for the data file.
    
    Warning
    -------
    Trial indices start at 1, not 0 (in contrast to Python indexing).

    See Also
    --------
    DataHandler: Mixin class for handling data files.
    """
    # Class attributes required by DataHandler
    data_loader: Callable[[str], np.ndarray] = np.load
    """Loader method for the data file (class attribute)."""
    data_saver: Callable[[str, np.ndarray], None] = np.save
    """Saver method for the data file (class attribute)."""
    empty_shape: Tuple[int, int] = (2, 0) # 2 rows, 0 columns
    """Shape of an empty array for consistency (class attribute)."""


[docs]    def __init__(self, 
                 unit_id:str, session_id:str, 
                 sampling_rate:float = SMPL_RATE):
        """
        Constructor - Instantiate a RawSession object for one unit in one recording session.

        Load the raw data (if possible) and set its basic properties.

        Parameters
        ----------
        unit_id: str
        session_id: str
        sampling_rate: float
            Default: :obj:`mtcdb.constants.SMPL_RATE`
        """
        self.unit_id = unit_id
        self.session_id = session_id
        self.path_data = self.get_path()
        self.spike, self.trials = self.load()
        try:
            self.n_trials = self.trials.max()
        except ValueError: # empty array
            self.n_trials = 0
        self.sampling_rate = sampling_rate

    
    def __repr__(self) -> str:
        return f"{self.__class__.__name__}(Unit {self.unit_id!r}, Session {self.session_id!r}"


[docs]    def get_path(self) -> str:
        """Construct the path for the data file."""
        return f"{DataHandler.data_dir}/{self.unit_id}/raw/{self.session_id}.npy"



[docs]    def load(self) -> Tuple[NDArray[np.float64], NDArray[np.int64]]:
        """
        Load the raw data from a ``.npy`` file, if possible.

        Returns
        -------
        spikes: NDArray[np.float64]
            Spiking times for the unit in the session.
        trials: NDArray[np.int64]
            Trial numbers associated with each spike.
        
        Notes
        -----
        The raw data of one neuron in one session is stored in a 
        ``ndarray`` of floats with shape ``(2, nspikes)``
        under the format ``[[trial numbers], [spiking times]]``.
        ``data[1]`` : Spiking times.
        ``data[0]`` : Trial numbers associated with each spike.
        In this initial array, trial indices are stored under type ``float``, 
        because of the constrained homogeneous types in numpy arrays.
        Here they are converted to integers.

        Warning
        -------
        This method overrides the ``load`` method of the base class ``DataHandler``.

        See Also
        --------
        DataHandler.load: Load data from a file.
        """
        data = super().load(self) # call the load method of DataHandler
        return data[1], data[0].astype(np.int64)

    


[docs]class FiringRates():
    """
    Firing rates for one unit in all the trials of all its recording sessions.

    Attributes
    ----------
    unit_id: str
        Unit's identifier.
    sessions: List[str]
        All the session identifiers.
    data: NDArray[np.float64]
        Firing rates for the unit in all the trials of all its recording sessions.
        Shape: ``(n_tpts, n_trials)``.
    n_trials: int
        Total number of trials across all the sessions.
    n_tpts: int
        Number of time points in a trial's time course.
    tmax: float
        Total duration the firing rate time course.
    t_on, t_off: float
        Times of the stimulus onset and offset.
    tbin: float
        Time bin for the firing rate time course.
    smooth_window: float
        Smoothing window size (in seconds).
    path_data: str
        Directory where the data files of the unit are stored.
    
    See Also
    --------
    DataHandler: Mixin class for handling data files.
    xr.DataArray: N-dimensional labeled array.

    Notes
    -----
    This class is a wrapper around a ``xarray.DataArray`` object,
    which is used to store the firing rates for one unit in all the trials.
    The data is saved in a netCDF file, with the following dimensions:
    - ``time``: time points in the trial's time course.
    - ``trial``: trial indexes.
    Accessing coordinates or methods specific to DataArray 
    becomes straightforward, without compromising the original 
    structure or requiring additional method calls.
    """
    # Class Attributes required by DataHandler
    data_loader: Callable[[str], np.ndarray] = xr.open_dataarray
    """Loader method for the data file (class attribute)."""
    data_saver: Callable[[str, np.ndarray], None] = xr.DataArray.to_netcdf
    """Saver method for the data file (class attribute)."""
    empty_shape: Tuple[int, int] = (0, 0) # 0 rows, 0 columns
    """Shape of an empty array for consistency (class attribute)."""


[docs]    def __init__(self, unit_id:str, 
                 tbin:float = TBIN, 
                 smooth_window:float = SMOOTH_WINDOW):
        """
        Constructor - Instantiate a FiringRates object for one unit.

        Two ways to instantiate a FiringRates object, 
        depending on the arguments provided to the consturctor:

        1. Only the arguments required for the path. No data.
           Then, data will be loaded from an existing ``.nc`` file 
           (previously computed during preprocessing).
           All the properties will be recovered from this object.
        2. If a data set is provided, Create an object from its basic properties, to save data for the first time.

        This class serves as an interface to save and retrieve data.

        Parameters
        ----------
        unit_id: str
        tbin: float
            Time bin for the firing rate time course.
        smooth_window: float
            Smoothing window size (in seconds).
        """
        self.unit_id = unit_id
        self.path_data = self.get_path()
        self.data = self.load()
        self.n_tpts, self.n_trials = self.data.shape
        self.tmax = self.n_tpts*tbin
        self.t_on = 0
        self.t_off = self.tmax
        self.tbin = tbin
        self.smooth_window = smooth_window

    

[docs]    def get_path(self) -> str:
        """Construct the path for the data file in netCDF format."""
        return f"{DataHandler.data_dir}/{self.unit_id}/firing_rates.nc"


    def __repr__(self) -> str:
        return f"{self.__class__.__name__}(Unit {self.unit_id!r}"
    
    def __getattr__(self, name):
        """
        Delegate attribute access to the DataArray.
        Intercept any attribute accesses that are not explicitly defined in 
        FiringRates. 
        If the attribute exists on the DataArray, it is returned. 
        Otherwise, an AttributeError is raised. 
        This allows custom_data.coords, custom_data.dims, 
        and similar properties to be accessed as if they are attributes of 
        FiringRates.
        """
        try:
            return getattr(self.data_array, name)
        except AttributeError:
            raise AttributeError(f"'FiringRates' object has no attribute '{name}'")
    
    def __getitem__(self, key):
        """
        Delegate item access to the DataArray for indexing and slicing 
        directly through FiringRates instances
        with the subscript notation (i.e., using square brackets) 
        X['x', :].
    
        """
        return self.data_array[key]
